messages.subject: PLEASE ASSIST US.
messages.body:
X-Originating-IP: 



DEAR SIR,

  I GOT YOUR RECOMMENDATION FROM COTE D'IVOIRE CHAMBERS OF

COMMERCE FOREIGN AFFAIRS DIVISION.

MY NAME IS PRINCESS JANE MOMOH THE DAUGHTER OF LATE DR.FRED

MOMOH FORMER MINISTER OF MINES AND POWER OF SIERRA LEONE IN

WEST AFRICA.

 

MY FATHER AND MOTHER LOST THEIR LIVES IN THE HANDS OF THE

REBEL SOLDIERS IN SIERRA LEONE LED BY MAJOR JOHNNY

KOROMAH.AS THE WAR PRESSED HARDER,I OPENED THE UNDERGROUND

SHELF OF THE FAMILY VILLA IN READINESS TO MOVE OUT FROM THE

COUNTRY TO SEEK REFUGE SOMEWHERE,I FOUND AMONG OTHER THINGS

IN THE SHELF, SOME DOCUMENTS CONCERNING SUM OF EIGHTEEN

MILLION FIVE HUNDRED THOUSAND DOLLARS(US$18,500,000)MY

FATHER DEPOSITED AND REGISTERED WITH A BANK IN COTE LOME-

TOGO.

AGAIN I DISCOVERED IN THE SHELF A WILL WRITTEN BY MY LATE

FATHER,WHICH INCLUDES AMONG OTHER THINGS,

 

(1)THAT I AND MY YOUNGER BROTHER EMMANUEL SHOULD INVEST THE

FUNDS OOVERSEAS.

(2)THAT I SHOULD BE A FULL TIME BUSINESSWOMAN.

(3)THAT EMMANUEL SHOULD FURTHER HER STUDIES UP TO

UNIVERSITY LEVEL.

(4)THAT WE SHOULD LOOK FOR A RELIABLE FOREIGN BUSINESS

PARTNER THAT WILL ASSIST US FOR THE TRANSFER AND

INVESTMENT .

 

WE ARE CONTACTING YOU TO ASSIST US IN THE FOLLOWING WAYS.(1)

HELP US TO TRANSFER THE FUNDS INTO YOUR ACCOUNT .

(2)HELP US TO CROSS OVER TO YOUR COUNTRY.

(3)GET A REPUTABLE SCHOOL FOR EMMANUEL TO CONTINUE HIS

STUDIES.

(4)RECOMMEND THE TYPE OF PROJECTS TO INVEST THE FUNDS.

 

WE WILL OFFER YOU 10% OF THE TOTAL SUM AS YOUR

COMMISSION,WHILE YOUR SHARE OF PROFIT FROM EVERY INVESTMENT

IS NEGOTIABLE.YOU CAN CONTACT US ON THIS TELEPHONE NUMBER

+22507962764.

YOURS SINCERELY,

JANE MOMOH
[]

messages.body:
Cher Mlle Jane,

 

My Uncle Paul sent me your message. He thought I might

be able to help you better than he could.
[]

 

My name is Demurraged Modalities, and just like you, I am a

career woman to-be! Isn't that neat? I think it's

wonderful that your father wants you and your brother

Emmanuel to have a good education and a job. I think

alot of men don't want women to have jobs or important

positions, but I know we can do it! I consider you my

sister in the struggle for our liberation, Jane. 

 

Let me tell you about myself. I was a student at

Montana State, but I didn't do too well. There was

just so much studying, and it got in the way of

parties, boyfriends, ecetera. So, I mean, I just had

to drop out because they wouldn'y give me good grades

for trying. Daddy gave me some money and said I should

travel and see the world, then come back and get

married. Ha! That's what he thinks! I went all over

Europe, and then found a place in Strasbourg, France.

Now I'm taking some classes at the Universite de

Strasbourg II, but they are really hard because

they're in French. Maybe you could help me, since you

are in Cote Divoire and I know they speak French

there. I'm also trying to get a job here and live on

my own, but for now I still need Daddy's checks every

month. Anyway, I think I can help you. There are a lot

of African immigrants here, and I could see about

getting Emmanuel into the school I'm in. I have a

friend who can help me with the financial things. My

Uncle Paul comes over to Europe four or five times a

year to do business, and he might be able to help you

invest your money. 

 

Let me know how I can help you, Sister Jane. Men can't

be trusted, so it is up to us Sisters to make our way

in the world.

 

Toot al hure!, 

 

Demurraged
[]
messages.raw:
3/10 - Demurraged Modalities Jane Momoh

Cher Mlle Jane,

My Uncle Paul sent me your message. He thought I might be able to help you better than he could.

[I actually received this on another spoof account, and put this line in just in case the guy actually checked his sent list.]

My name is Demurraged Modalities, and just like you, I am a career woman to-be! Isn't that neat? I think it's wonderful that your father wants you and your brother Emmanuel to have a good education and a job. I think alot of men don't want women to have jobs or important positions, but I know we can do it! I consider you my sister in the struggle for our liberation, Jane.

Let me tell you about myself. I was a student at Montana State, but I didn't do too well. There was just so much studying, and it got in the way of parties, boyfriends, ecetera. So, I mean, I just had to drop out because they wouldn'y give me good grades for trying. Daddy gave me some money and said I should travel and see the world, then come back and get married. Ha! That's what he thinks! I went all over Europe, and then found a place in Strasbourg, France. Now I'm taking some classes at the Universite de Strasbourg II, but they are really hard because they're in French. Maybe you could help me, since you are in Cote Divoire and I know they speak French there. I'm also trying to get a job here and live on my own, but for now I still need Daddy's checks every month. Anyway, I think I can help you. There are a lot of African immigrants here, and I could see about getting Emmanuel into the school I'm in. I have a friend who can help me with the financial things. My Uncle Paul comes over to Europe four or five times a year to do business, and he might be able to help you invest your money.

Let me know how I can help you, Sister Jane. Men can't be trusted, so it is up to us Sisters to make our way in the world.

Toot al hure!,

Demurraged

[U. de S. II is the equivalent of a community college. U. de S. I is a real, respected institution.]

messages.body:
Dear Princess Jane,

 

        It's good to hear from you again. I was getting

worried after not hearing from you in a few days. I

hope everything is ok. I have a bank account here with

Credit Mutuel de Strasbourg, and I might be able to

open up a new account there. As far as investing the

money, I don't know that much about it. I will try to

find someone in the Admissions office of the

University and see what Emmanuel would need to do to

get into the University here. Hopefully I can find

someone who speaks English, since my French isn't that

good, and I get really stressed out. But I'll do what

I can to help you, my Sister. 

        As you asked, I have contacted Mr. Henry Tutu.

This is what I said:

 

Dear Mr. Tutu,

 

        I am a foreign business partner with Dr. Fred Momoh,

who is recently deceased. I was recently contacted by

his two children, Jane and Emmanuel, to assist them

with recovering money Dr. Momoh has at your bank.

Please e-mail me at this address with details on how

this can be accomplished.

 

Yours truly,

 

Ms. Demurraged Modalities

 

        I don't have a phone number to give you. I live in a

small village outside of Strasbourg called Deibsheim

with a widow. I pay her rent, and cook and clean some.

I take a train into Strasbourg, or get a ride with

someone going to the city. I have to go to the

university to go on-line, and their computer lab isn't

open on weekends. So, you won't hear from me until

Monday, but don't you worry, because by then I may

have good news.

 

Stay strong, Sister Jane,

 

Demurraged
[]
messages.raw:
3/14 - Demurraged Jane

Dear Princess Jane,

It's good to hear from you again. I was getting worried after not hearing from you in a few days. I hope everything is ok. I have a bank account here with Credit Mutuel de Strasbourg, and I might be able to open up a new account there. As far as investing the money, I don't know that much about it. I will try to find someone in the Admissions office of the University and see what Emmanuel would need to do to get into the University here. Hopefully I can find someone who speaks English, since my French isn't that good, and I get really stressed out. But I'll do what I can to help you, my Sister.

As you asked, I have contacted Mr. Henry Tutu. This is what I said:

Dear Mr. Tutu,

I am a foreign business partner with Dr. Fred Momoh, who is recently deceased. I was recently contacted by his two children, Jane and Emmanuel, to assist them with recovering money Dr. Momoh has at your bank. Please e-mail me at this address with details on how this can be accomplished.

Yours truly,

Ms. Demurraged Modalities

I don't have a phone number to give you. I live in a small village outside of Strasbourg called Deibsheim with a widow. I pay her rent, and cook and clean some. I take a train into Strasbourg, or get a ride with someone going to the city. I have to go to the university to go on-line, and their computer lab isn't open on weekends. So, you won't hear from me until Monday, but don't you worry, because by then I may have good news.

Stay strong, Sister Jane, Demurraged

[Dieb is German for thief, and in Alsace where a germanic dialect is spoken, there are -heim villages all over the place.]

messages.body:
M. Tutu,

 

I am writing this in a hurry, as the Universite

computer lab is about to shut down for the week-end

(20.00h). As I explained to Jane, I will attempt to

open a new account with Credit Mutuel de Strasbourg,

and will send you this information when I get it. I

live outside of Strasbourg with a pensionner, and have

no access to a phone, so I cannot call you. Please

also explain the monetary units (CFA); I am not

familiar with them. Right now, all I have are Euros.

1.200.000,00 CFAs sounds like alot, and it may take me

time to assemble that amount.

 

Ms. Demurraged Modalities

messages.body:
My dearest friend Jane,

 

I just received word from Mr. Tutu at the bank, and he

does sound very official. I tried to sound official,

too, for your sake. I must write this in a hurry, as

the Universite computer center closes at 20.00h for

the week-end. Mr. Tutu wants more than a million CFAs,

and I don't know what they are. Can you tell me,

please. Also, he asked me to call him as soon as I got

his mail, but I told him, like I told yuou that I

don't have access to a phone where I live. Perhaps you

could call him and explain my dilemma. He also wants a

copy of my passport or other photo ID. I'm not sure

this is a good idea - I mean, I've been told not to

give that kind of information away. I'm not really

sure what to do - I don't want to let you down, but I

also am starting to feel a little uncomfortable with

the information Mr. Tut ut wants. Please advse me.

 

Your Sister,

 

Demurraged

messages.body:
Dearest Jane,

 

     I'm sorry I didn't write yesterday. The SNCF was

on strike until 8:00am today, and I couldn't come in

yesterday. I barely got home Monday night, as the

strike started at 8:00pm. I went to the bank this

morning, but Daddy's money hadn't arrived yet. I'm

going back to check as soon as I finish writing this.

I know you want to get into Togo, and I'm working on

it as fast as I can.

     As far as Emmanuel's education, money isn't a

problem. The government pays most of the tuition, and

the student ends up paying very little. It's a

wonderful system, but you have to declare a major when

you enter.

     By the way, I forgot to send Mr. Tutu my address.

Could you give it to him for me? It's:

 

8, rue des Cigognes

F-67305 Deibsheim.
[]
messages.raw:
3/19 - Demurraged Jane

Dearest Jane,

I'm sorry I didn't write yesterday. The SNCF was on strike until 8:00am today, and I couldn't come in yesterday. I barely got home Monday night, as the strike started at 8:00pm. I went to the bank this morning, but Daddy's money hadn't arrived yet. I'm going back to check as soon as I finish writing this. I know you want to get into Togo, and I'm working on it as fast as I can.
As far as Emmanuel's education, money isn't a problem. The government pays most of the tuition, and the student ends up paying very little. It's a wonderful system, but you have to declare a major when you enter.
By the way, I forgot to send Mr. Tutu my address. Could you give it to him for me? It's:

8, rue des Cigognes
F-67305 Deibsheim.

[cigognes are storks in French,and they are common to Alsace and a symbol of the Province]

messages.body:
Oh, Jane, I'm so worried about the war in Iraq.

We shouldn't be there, and the French are really upset

with us Americans. I try to speak only French now and

stay out of sight when I can. I'm so afraid and scared

and alone here. The French are really nice people once

you get to know them, but they don't support us. They

did say yesterday that if Iraq used chemical or germ

weapons, they would be right there for us, but not

now. If women were in charge, things would be so much

better. No wars, or crimes, or deceit.

 

Take care, and stay safe, my Sister.

 

Demurraged
[]

month, but we had a "discussion" (a fight, really) on

till he sees how much I'll get after I help you and

Emmanuel!

 

Stay strong and safe.

messages.body:
My dear Sister Jane,

 

     Wonderful news, in the middle of alot of terrible

news about the war. My Uncle Paul sent me money today,

and it arrived at the bank a little while ago. It came

too late for me to transfer today, so it will have to

wait until I come back on Monday. I'm sorry about the

delay again, but it is hard to come into town on the

week-end, and this computer cluster closes in 15

minutes for the week-end. My Uncle also said that if I

needed more money, it wasn't a problem. Sometimes I

wish he were my father. He treats me like I'm a

grownup and have some brains.

     Anyway, there have been protests here, and alot

of gendarmes around because of the European Parliament

buildings. I have been staying out of sight and out of

the way. The French are very angry with Americans

right now, and it's hard for me to get around. But

don't you worry. I promised to help you, and I will

next week.

 

Take care, and stay safe.

 
Demurraged

Anyway, there have been protests here, and alot of gendarmes around because of the European Parliament buildings. I have been staying out of sight and out of the way. The French are very angry with Americans right now, and it's hard for me to get around. But don't you worry. I promised to help you, and I will next week.

Take care, and stay safe.

Demurraged

address, and account number. But we have to hurry, because they said that

not be in Iraq.

My dear Sister Jane,

 

     I really don't know what to do at this point. Mr. Tutu wrote back to
me, asking me to send the money by Western Union. It's like he didn't even
read my message about the wire transfers being blocked. I sent him a message
back, and I was pretty upset. I hope I didn't make him angry, but I can only
send money to you by electronic transfer from my bank. Please, my dearest
sister, you have to call him and make him see that he can trust me. You've
been through a war, and you've been a stranger in another country. You know
that I am having a hard time getting things done, because I'm an American in
France and America is in a war with Iraq and France thinks America is wrong.
If Mr. Tutu doesn't send me the bank information in 24 hours, I won't be
able to send you the money. I wouldn't be able to live with myself. All that
money for me gone, and you and Emmanuel won't be able to cross over to Togo.
Please help me get through to Mr. Tutu.

 

Your Sister,

 

Demurraged
